intro: Peucedanum stuhlmannii, commonly known as Stuhlmann's angelica, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, compound leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Peucedanum stuhlmannii is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
